Description
ApiClient
ApiClient provides a minimal HTTP client for interacting with the local ApiServer.

ApiServer exposes a minimal local REST API for managing drills.

Basic metrics calculations (accuracy and WPM).

CustomDrillController handles creation of user-defined drills.

Handles saving and loading the game state from disk.

Represents a typing drill (exercise).

DrillSeeder
Seeds baseline drills if missing.
DrillService
 
FileUserRepository
FileUserRepository implements UserRepository using local file storage.
GameState
Represents the overall saved state of the typing game.
LeaderboardRepository
Read-only leaderboard queries using the sessions table.

Simple DTO for leaderboard rows.
LeaderboardsController

Leaderboard read service (maps repo rows to simple DTOs).

Simple DTO for UI or controllers.
LoginController
LoginController handles user authentication and registration.
MainApp
 
MainMenu
 
OptionsMenuController
OptionsMenuController handles navigation from the options menu back to the main menu.
PlayMenu
 
ProfileController
ProfileController displays user statistics and handles navigation to gameplay, logout, and main menu.
Progress
Tracks a user's overall progress in the typing game.
ProgressService
Dynamically computes how far the user is unlocked, from Tier 1 up to whatever exists in DB.
Rank
 
RankLoader
 
SceneManager
SceneManager handles switching between FXML views.
SentenceProvider
SentenceProvider is a utility class that supplies target sentences for the typing game.
Session
Represents a typing session result.
SessionRepository
Simple repository for typing sessions.
SessionRepository.LeaderboardRow
Simple DTO for leaderboard rows.
SessionService
Records typing sessions and computes WPM/accuracy.
SqliteUserRepository
 
TypingGameController
TypingGameController handles gameplay logic, UI updates, and user stat tracking.
TypingStats
Tracks typing performance metrics during a session, including accuracy, words per minute (WPM), and streaks of correct input.
User
Commented out a bunch of stuff that isn't necessary due to the new db structure.
User
Represents a player in the typing game.
UserManager
 
UserRepository
Defines the contract for user data persistence.
